intro: Wormia pauciflora, commonly known as the slender moss, is a species of moss that belongs to the family Dicranaceae. It is characterized by its delicate, hair-like shoots and small, clustered capsules that produce spores. This plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors or rocky crevices. Its leaves are narrow and often have a distinct midrib, contributing to its overall appearance. Wormia pauciflora plays a vital role in soil stabilization and nutrient cycling in its ecosystem.
